keyMoments.title: Captain Bartolomeo's Power Revealed
keyMoments.description: Bartolomeo, captain of the Barto Club, reveals his formidable Bari Bari no Mi Devil Fruit powers during the Block B battle, establishing himself as one of the most dangerous competitors.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the crew captain's incredible defensive abilities, showing why the Barto Club is a force to be reckoned with in the New World.

keyMoments.title: Bellamy's Ruthless Display
keyMoments.description: Captain Bellamy demonstrates his evolved fighting style with a brutal defeat of Abdullah and Jeet, showing the Bellamy Pirates' adaptation to New World combat.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals how the crew and its captain have become more ruthless and powerful since their earlier appearances, reflecting their experiences in the New World.

keyMoments.title: Chinjao's Grudge Against Garp's Lineage
keyMoments.description: Don Chinjao, former leader of the Happo Navy, exposes Luffy's identity as Monkey D. Luffy due to his deep-seated grudge against Luffy's grandfather Garp.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the Happo Navy's connection to the Monkey D. family through Chinjao's past conflict with Garp, establishing a multi-generational rivalry.

keyMoments.title: Happo Navy's Strategic Coordination
keyMoments.description: Current leader Sai and member Boo demonstrate the Happo Navy's strategic thinking by preventing Chinjao's disqualification, showing the crew's coordinated decision-making.
keyMoments.significance: Displays the crew's tactical approach and family dynamics, with younger generation members managing the elder's rage for strategic advantage.

keyMoments.title: Cavendish's Hunt for Luffy
keyMoments.description: Captain Cavendish of the Beautiful Pirates pursues Luffy with murderous intent after his identity is revealed, driven by his hatred of the Worst Generation.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the Beautiful Pirates' antagonistic stance toward the Worst Generation, particularly targeting Luffy as one of the rookies who stole Cavendish's spotlight.
